Explorando Series Temporais

Author

Ricardo Accioly

Published

June 7, 2023

Carregando e visualizando dados de Produção de Cerveja

library(fpp2)
Registered S3 method overwritten by 'quantmod':
  method            from
  as.zoo.data.frame zoo 
── Attaching packages ────────────────────────────────────────────── fpp2 2.5 ──
✔ ggplot2   3.4.2     ✔ fma       2.5  
✔ forecast  8.21      ✔ expsmooth 2.3  
data(ausbeer)
autoplot(ausbeer)

Separando dois trechos da serie

library(tsibble)

Attaching package: 'tsibble'
The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    intersect, setdiff, union
library(feasts)
Carregando pacotes exigidos: fabletools

Attaching package: 'fabletools'
The following object is masked from 'package:forecast':

    accuracy
ausbeer2 <- as_tsibble(ausbeer)
serie1 <- ausbeer2 %>% filter_index("1960 Q1" ~ "1964 Q4")
gg_season(serie1)
Plot variable not specified, automatically selected `y = value`

gg_subseries(serie1)
Plot variable not specified, automatically selected `y = value`

serie2 <- ausbeer2 %>% filter_index("2005 Q1" ~ "2009 Q4")
gg_season(serie2)
Plot variable not specified, automatically selected `y = value`

gg_subseries(serie2)
Plot variable not specified, automatically selected `y = value`

Decomposição Aditiva

library(foreign)
prodcerv <- scan("beerprod.dat")
prodcerv <- ts(prodcerv, start = 1960, freq = 4)
autoplot(prodcerv)

decompos1 <- decompose(prodcerv, type = "additive")
plot(decompos1)

decompos1
